definition: gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: What gift would you like to give them at your first meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你想送什么见面礼给它们呢？

sentences.english: You just took the "gift" and came back?
sentences.chinese: 然后你拿了“见面礼”就回来了？

sentences.english: This is that I give your encounter a gift.
Why didn't you share in my welcome gift?
sentences.chinese: 为什么他们都有见面礼，就你没有呢？

sentences.english: I heard that you are fond of collecting NVIDIA products, and this is greeting gift.
sentences.chinese: 听说你喜欢收集NVIDIA的东西，这个是见面礼。

sentences.english: Now, we have realized that Elsevier's gentleness is only one time discount for the first time meet.
sentences.chinese: 现在看来，这些只是一份见面礼，一块敲门砖。

definition: to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to show filial respect/to give presents (to one's elders or superiors)/to support one's aged parents
lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
to offer an apology/to make amends
lit. proper behavior is based on reciprocity (idiom)/fig. to return politeness for politeness
Don't get a reward if it's not deserved. (idiom)
